page.title: 20QUEENS VISIT TO SOUTHPORT
page.content: The Queen arrived promptly at Southport station at 10:00am on the 29th June 1985.The Queen arrived on board her personal train and was met by The Mayor of Sefton.The Queen was then introduced to a 102 year old resident of Southport.After being given flowers from the cheering crowds she was led to a waiting car.With a police escort she travelled down London Street towards the war monument and left down Lord Street.The route was lined with people and many of the shops were decorated with flags. After the Queens brief visit,she travelled out of Southport to the Altcar Training Camp near Formby.The visit was a private one to inspect the Duke of Lancaster's Yeomanry. As soon as her visit was over she flew back to London from Woodvale Air-Base.
